Package br.com.armange.commons.thread.async

Class TryAsyncBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.armange.commons.thread.async.TryAsyncBuilder
  • public final class TryAsyncBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    It is a thread builder that assists in creating structured threads to simulate a set of try-catch-finally or try-with-resources blocks.

    Example without resources

         @Test
     public void shouldSayHello() throws InterruptedException {
         final StringBuilder message = new StringBuilder();
         final RunnableWithException sayHello = () -> {
             message.append("Hello ");
             throw new Exception("Just a test");
         };

         // try {
         //     message.append("Hello ");
         //     throw new Exception("Just a test");
         // } catch (final Exception e) {
         //     message.append("world");
         // } finally {
         //     message.append("!");
         // }
         tryAsync(sayHello)
                 .addCatcher(Exception.class,exception ->
                         message.append("world"))
                 .addFinalizer(() -> message.append("!"))
                 .execute();

         Thread.sleep(1000);
         Assert.assertEquals("Hello world!",message.toString());
     }

    Example with I/O

         @Test
     public void shouldWriteHello() throws IOException {
         final Path tempPath = Files.createTempFile("hello", ".txt");
         final File tempFile = new File(tempPath.toString());
         final FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter(tempFile);
         final String fileContent = "Hello world!";

         // try (final FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter(tempFile)) {
         //     fileWriter.write(fileContent);
         //     fileWriter.flush();
         // } catch (final Exception e) {
         //     ...
         // }
         tryAsync(fileWriter, f -> {
             fileWriter.write(fileContent);
             fileWriter.flush();
         }).execute();

         final String content = Files.readAllLines(tempPath).get(0);

         Assert.assertEquals(fileContent, content);
     }
    Since:
    2020-06-22 V1.1.0 (JDK 1.8)

      It creates a new thread builder that supports creating threads that are structured to simulate a try-with-resources block code.
      The try-with-resources block will be simulated through a thread that will execute a consumer receiving a closeable object as a parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • tryAsync

        public static RunnableTryAsyncBuilder tryAsync​(RunnableWithException execution)
        It creates a new thread builder that supports creating threads that are structured to simulate a try-catch block code.
        Parameters:
        execution - The Runnable interface should be implemented by any class whose instances are intended to be executed by a thread. The class must define a method of no arguments called run.
        Returns:
        A thread constructor with a defined thread implementation.

      • tryAsync

        public static <T> CallableTryAsyncBuilder<T> tryAsync​(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> callable,
                                                      java.util.function.Consumer<T> resultConsumer)
        This creates a new thread builder that supports creating threads that are structured to simulate a try-catch block code.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object resulting from the execution of the thread.
        Parameters:
        callable - A task that returns a result and may throw an exception.
        resultConsumer - The consumer for the thread's execution result.
        Returns:
        A thread constructor with a defined thread implementation and an implementation of a consumer for the object resulting from the thread's execution.

      • tryAsync

        public static ResourceTryAsyncBuilder tryAsync​(java.io.Closeable closeable,
                                               ResourceConsumer attemptedExecution)
        It creates a new thread builder that supports creating threads that are structured to simulate a try-with-resources block code.
        The try-with-resources block will be simulated through a thread that will execute a consumer receiving a closeable object as a parameter. The consumer of the closeable object will be the only implementation executed within the thread, so this implementation represents the try block of a set of try-with-resources blocks. After the thread runs the closeable object will be closed. Any exception (which extends the Exception class) that occurs within the execution (implementation) of the thread, will be encapsulated in the AsyncRuntimeException class.
        Parameters:
        closeable - A Closeable is a source or destination of data that can be closed. The close method is invoked to release resources that the object is holding (such as open files). This parameter corresponds to the declaration of one or more items within the try-with-resources block, which will later be automatically closed.
        attemptedExecution - The implementation of a consumer that will consume an implementation of a Closeable.
        Returns:
        A thread constructor with a defined thread implementation.

      • tryAsync

        public static ResourcesTryAsyncBuilder tryAsync​(ResourcesConsumer attemptedExecution,
                                                java.io.Closeable... resources)
        It creates a new thread builder that supports creating threads that are structured to simulate a try-with-resources block code.
        The try-with-resources block will be simulated through a thread that will execute a consumer receiving a closeable object as a parameter. The consumer of the closeable object will be the only implementation executed within the thread, so this implementation represents the try block of a set of try-with-resources blocks. After the thread runs the closeable object will be closed. Any exception (which extends the Exception class) that occurs within the execution (implementation) of the thread, will be encapsulated in the AsyncRuntimeException class.
        Parameters:
        attemptedExecution - The implementation of a consumer that will consume implementations of a Closeable.
        resources - A Closeable is a source or destination of data that can be closed. The close method is invoked to release resources that the object is holding (such as open files). This parameter corresponds to the declaration of one or more items within the try-with-resources block, which will later be automatically closed.
        Returns:
        A thread constructor with a defined thread implementation.
